long_description: The MurmurHash function computes the hash values of the input columns. MurmurHash is a noncryptographic hash function suitable for hash-based searching. The function computes the MurmurHash value of each column value in each row of the input table.

input_tables.name: input
input_tables.rDescription: The input table that contains the data.
input_tables.description: The input table that contains the data.

argument_clauses.name: InputColumns
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the names of the input table columns for which to calculate hash values. Note: NULL values in the input columns are output as NULL.
argument_clauses.description: Specify the names of the input table columns for which to calculate hash values. Note: NULL values in the input columns are output as NULL.

argument_clauses.name: Accumulate
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the names of the input table columns to copy to the output table.
argument_clauses.description: Specify the names of the input table columns to copy to the output table.

argument_clauses.name: HashBit
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies whether the function generates 32-bit hash values (the default) or 64-bit hash values.
argument_clauses.description: Specify whether the function creates 32-bit or 64-bit hash values. Default: 32-bit hash values

argument_clauses.name: SequenceInputBy
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the LIST_VECTOR of column(s) that uniquely identifies each row of the input argument INPUT_ARG_NAME. The argument is used to ensure deterministic results for functions which produce results that vary from run to run.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the input column(s) that uniquely identify each row of input table. The format is 'input1:c1' where input1 refers to the alias used by the input table that contains such column named c1.
